title: Coffee Break Collection 18 - Pirates
description: This is the eighteenth Coffee Break Collection, in which Librivox readers select English language public domain works of about 15 minutes or less in duration -- perfect to listen to during commutes, workouts or coffee breaks. The topic for this collection is pirates... a rich source of material. Fiction, non-fiction, poetry, prose, essays... the romance of a life on the ocean waves and the danger posed by the 'bad boys (and girls)'; but sometimes the law catches up with them.

sections.title: A Ballad of John Silver by John Masefield
An Old Song Resung by John Masefield
The Adventures, Trial and Execution of Captain Gow by Charles Ellms
Adventure with Pirates, by James O. Brayman
Capture of a Chinese Pirate Fleet by Anonymous
Derelict: A Reminiscence of Treasure Island by Young E. Allison
Execution of the Pirates by Ezra Baldwin Strong
Home of Blackbeard, One of America's Cruelest Pirates by Anonymous, from the Dawson Record, August 16, 1903
The Life and Exploits of Anne Bonney by Charles Ellms
The Life of John Massey, Who Died for Piracy by Arthur L. Hayward
The Life of Philip Roche, a Pirate, etc. by Arthur L. Hayward
Captain Thomas White  by Henry Hartford Benton and Thomas Carey
The United States v. Smith, 1820 US Supreme Court
The Yankee Privateer by Arthur Hale
